mainArticle.title: Beliefs
mainArticle.content: FOCUS helps you train your attention and stay present—one phrase at a time.

words.definition: A set of ideas or principles that someone holds to be true
words.example: His beliefs about the future were based on his experiences.

words.definition: A deeply distressing or disturbing experience
words.example: The accident was a traumatic experience for her.

words.definition: In a hopeful or optimistic manner
words.example: Hopefully, the weather will be better tomorrow.

words.definition: Relating to or involving the mind or mental processes
words.example: The cognitive abilities of the child were tested to determine if he had a learning disability.

words.definition: A magical or religious utterance or spell
words.example: The priest chanted an incantation to bless the couple.

words.definition: Giving someone the ability to do something
words.example: The new law empowers the police to arrest suspects without a warrant.
